definition: A term referring to the action of rapidly growing or shooting upwards, typically used to describe the growth of a plant or the sudden increase in size or height of an object. It can also be used metaphorically to describe a sudden surge or rise in various contexts.

examples.english: The ball shot into the goal.

examples.german: Er schoss ein Foto von der Landschaft.
examples.english: He took a photo of the landscape.

examples.german: Die Rakete schoss in den Himmel.
examples.english: The rocket shot into the sky.

examples.german: Sie schoss mit dem Gewehr auf das Ziel.
examples.english: She shot at the target with the rifle.

examples.german: Der Pfeil schoss durch die Luft.
examples.english: The arrow shot through the air.
